	<item>
		<title>A Day In The Life Of A VDBA</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/virtual-dba/day-in-the-life-of-vdba</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 11 Apr 2013 16:13:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[lowrykozlowski]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8501</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As part of SWC’s <a title="Managed Services" href="/solutions/managed-services">managed services offering</a>, we provide <a title="Virtual Database Administrator Services" href="/solutions/managed-services/virtual-dba">virtual database administration</a> (VDBA) services. We have found that the majority of the midmarket organizations we serve have <a title="SQL Server Services" href="/solutions/business-intelligence/microsoft-sql-server-2012">SQL databases</a>, but don’t always have a fulltime SQL database administrator on staff dedicated to maintaining them. This can lead to network performance problems, backup issues and slow running applications. SWC provides VDBA services to help these organizations optimize SQL performance and improve the reliability of their environment.

I thought it might be interesting to share the following blog on ‘a day in the life of a VDBA’ at SWC to further explain what our VDBAs do on a daily basis to ensure that our customer’s environments are optimally performing.
<ol>
	<li>Get a cup of hot coffee!</li>
	<li>Open and review email from clients and the Managed Services team regarding SQL Server issues requiring our support</li>
	<li>Check Network Operating Center (NOC) dashboard for thresholds that have been breached (failures and warnings) for VDBA clients. NOC team sends alerts and emails on issues with SQL Servers to the client and the VDBA team.</li>
	<li>Review job success\failure emails from overnight VDBA maintenance jobs. Failure jobs are reviewed daily, investigating the reason of failure and resolving and researching any remaining issues. Failure is documented in a report for the team. Any issues needing client approval are entered into a ticket and contact is made with the client to discuss resolution.</li>
	<li>Perform a quick review of client SQL Server systems in order to head off any potential problems in regard to capacity or performance. Trends regarding disk capacity and memory usage can be reviewed over the last 90 days to help identify potential pain points. This is done weekly.</li>
	<li>Software team had performance issues on a client system overnight. Meet to discuss the issue and research possible cause. Map out a strategy to monitor, and discuss ongoing performance enhancements.</li>
	<li>Assist a <a title="Software Developer Job Chicago" href="/careers/chicago-application-software-developer-job">developer</a> in finding the best way to test data compression.</li>
	<li>Test a cool new script to see if it would solve ongoing space issues.</li>
	<li>Find a known bug in client’s SQL 2000 server causing a job to fail. Build a workaround solution to allow job to succeed, but reminded customer again that we need a plan for migration off of SQL2000!</li>
	<li>Help a Managed Services client with space issues and failing backup jobs. Build a script to perform after business hours process to restore space back to the system and reduce the footprint of the database. Backup, shrink, backup, and rebuild indexes after hours.</li>
	<li>Take a break to grab some candy from the receptionist’s desk.</li>
	<li>Work with engineering lead on a client’s SQL server to open appropriate firewalls to allow replication between two systems.</li>
	<li>Work with <a title="Engagement Manager Job Chicago" href="/careers/chicago-business-engagement-manager-job">Engagement Manager</a> and Account lead on a client’s request for SQL support; develop strategy to meet their needs.</li>
	<li>Assist Account lead with a client SQL system having performance issues. This could be due to poor application or database performance. Perform very quick high level review of system to identify potential performance issues and offer ideas on resolutions. Often poor performance is a result of inadequate database or query design, with things like missing keys or indexes on tables or improper join construction on queries being the usual cause.</li>
	<li>Notified of free lunch in the kitchen, so sprint to the kitchen to enjoy pizza with co-workers!</li>
	<li>Respond to client request for after business hours SQL work. Contact client and discuss details and best time to perform task. Notify NOC team of potential outage after hours.</li>
	<li>Create documentation for build of a new SQL Server instance for VDBA client. Include best practices to follow in any SQL Server installation considering server function, scope and client preference.</li>
	<li>Work on client’s monthly VDBA report.</li>
	<li>Throughout the day, we check that there are no new alerts emails that need attention.</li>
	<li>Go home and spend time with family and relax, knowing SWC’s managed services team has my client’s covered!</li>
</ol>
Please click the following link to learn more about SWC’s VDBA services or join us for our next information Managed Services event.

If you enjoyed reading this post, please take a moment to read a few past posts on IT managed services.
<a title="SWC Managed Services – A More Strategic Approach to IT" href="/blog/managed-services/swc-strategic-approach-managed-it-services">SWC Managed Services – A More Strategic Approach to IT</a>

</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SWC&#039;s Beers With Brad – Big Data</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/swc-beers-with-brad-big-data</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 15 Apr 2013 18:24:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[bradellison]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8520</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="/swc-technology-partners/about-swc">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC’s live web show Beers with Brad aired Friday, April 12th at <a href="http://www.binnys.com" target="_blank">Binny’s Beverage Depot</a> South Loop store in Chicago! Beers with Brad is a technical happy hour streaming live on select Fridays at 4PM (CST). This interactive show gives viewers the ability to tweet in questions about various technologies and get them answered on the show! On Friday’s Beers with Brad, Brad Ellison and his guests discussed Big Data. Watch this week’s episode of Beers with Brad to learn more about the privacy vs. convenience of Big Data.

<a title="Microsoft System Center 2012 - SWC IT Consulting" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/j9tOdoZmoSM?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-beers-with-brad-041213-big-data.jpg" alt="Watch Beers With Brad Big Data" width="500" height="281" /></a>

Roger Adamson, Beer and Spirits Specialist at Binny’s Beverage Depot in Willowbrook, joined Brad for another show! The three beers Roger sampled on the show were the Dortmunder Gold and Rye of Tiger from Great Lakes Brewing Company and Weihenstephaner Hefe Weiss Dunkel from Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan all the way in Germany. According to Roger, the Dortmunder Gold is a great beer to drink anytime since its light and has a very moderate hop level. If you like hops, Rye of the Tiger is the beer for you. Roger stated, “If you love hops and being adventurous, you will love this beer.” Finally, the Weihenstephaner Hefe Weiss Dunkel is a great beer to pair with a burger and any dinner time meal.

After the beer talk, Brad and his guests discussed the topic of Big Data while many tweeted in their questions. Joining Brad for this topic was Jeremy Alt, <a title="IT Consultants" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consultant</a> at SWC, Katie Mowery, Account Manager and Digital Marketing Specialist at Tech Image and Suzie Saxman, attorney at Seyfarth Shaw LLP. Brad and his guests discussed the various levels of Big Data and how it can impact many. Suzie explained that the information we release on social media sites is public access, so we need to be aware of the information we post. Katie described how Big Data helps marketers and consumers and many people need to be more aware of what they are “opting into.” Viewers tweeted in their questions during the show, some that were answered included: “What data should you never divulge online?” “What are the benefits of Big Data?” and “Are companies able to take all of our information?”

Please join us for our next <a title="SWC's Beers With Brad Event Registration" href="/bwb/">Beers with Brad</a> on Friday, April 26th a 4PM (CST)! Don’t forget to tweet <a title="SWC Twitter" href="https://twitter.com/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">@SWCTechPartners</a> all of your IT questions for Brad and his guests to answer live on the show!

If you enjoyed this post, please take a moment to read a few other related SWC posts.

	<item>
		<title>Microsoft Unified Communications and the Mobile Office</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/unified-communications/microsoft-unified-communications-creates-mobile-office-world</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 24 Apr 2013 12:00:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[ericvalderrama]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8549</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[User mobility has taken root in contemporary culture and affected the way billions of people work and communicate. Central to the mobility movement is the need or desire to improve efficiency, and create opportunity for dynamic moments to occur. Modern business tools such as email and conferencing services have played key roles in transitioning to an extended or mobile office world. Next generation tools such as <a title="Microsoft Lync 2013" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013">Microsoft Lync 2013</a> can transform a PC, tablet or smartphone into a comprehensive communication device that extends the corporate experience to any location, with VOIP, Video Conferencing, Persistent Chartrooms and Instant Messaging.

From home, a coffee shop, at the airport or a hotel, <a title="Lync 2013 Consulting" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013">Lync 2013</a> enables the workforce to remain productive and in touch without the need for a VPN. With simplified Lync Meetings, users from multiple locations can collaborate in real time with audio and video. They also have the ability to upload PowerPoint presentations to share as well as other documents, and can chat either one on one or with the group.

These technologies have also been extended to mobile devices such as tablets and smartphones. Lync 2013 Mobile Clients are now available for iOS, Android, and Windows 8 platforms. In 2013, joining conferences from mobile devices is an easy, smooth and intuitive experience. Perhaps the most anticipated feature of the Lync 2013 Mobile Client has been the ability to make VOIP and video calls from you device with either a Wi-Fi or cellular signal. <a title="Microsoft Unified Communications" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Microsoft Unified Communications</a> platform has created a mobile office world of endless possibilities!

If you’d like assistance planning your path and preparing for your Lync 2013, please join us for our next <a title="Unified Communications Event" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Unified Communications event</a>.

To learn more about Microsoft Lync 2013, please read a few of our recent blogs:
<a title="New Microsoft Lync 2013 Server Features" href="/blog/unified-communications/new-microsoft-lync-2013-server-features">New Microsoft Lync 2013 Server Features</a>
<a title="Microsoft Lync 2013 Resiliency Enhancements" href="/blog/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013-resiliency-enhancements">Microsoft Lync 2013 Resiliency Enhancements</a>
</content:encoded>

		<title>SWC TV Announces New Show: Silicon City Featuring Ox&amp;Pen</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/silicon-city/swc-tv-announces-silicon-city</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 18 Apr 2013 19:06:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8582</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="SWC Technology Partners" href="http://www.swc.com">SWC Technology Partners</a> announces our new web show, Silicon City. Silicon City focuses on the exciting startup scene in Chicago. Each show features a different local startup giving them the unique opportunity to talk about their company, endeavors and experiences, and pitch their product. Check out this week’s episode of Silicon City featuring Andrew Gluck, Founder and CEO of Ox&amp;Pen.

<a title="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Chicago's OX &amp; Pen" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/sKfMr7qQl_w?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/silicon-city-oxandpen.jpg" alt="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Chicago's OX &amp; Pen" width="474" height="262" /></a>

On this week’s show, Silicon City host <a title="SWC VP Elliott Baretz" href="/swc-technology-partners/leadership/elliott-baretz">Elliott Baretz</a>, Vice President of Marketing and Business Development at SWC and Andrew Gluck discuss the nature of being a startup located in Chicago. Ox&amp;Pen is a loyalty reward program for local shops and restaurants. Their mobile application lets you check in, earn points and share locations with your friends, offering users the ability to promote and gain rewards at all businesses in the Ox&amp;Pen network.

Andrew Gluck stays true to his Chicago roots, is a loyal Cubs fan and continually pursues the Chicago startup scene. “There is great energy here in Chicago,” said Andrew. “Chicago is becoming a hub (for startups) and I’m excited to be part of that.” With 1871 and an emerging startup community full of active venture capitalists, Chicago is a great location to launch a new business.

“We have the right team in place and we are excited for what’s ahead,” said Andrew. The Ox&amp;Pen team includes many young and ambitious individuals who believe in the company and are focused on its success. Part of their business strategy includes recognizing their team’s strengths and outsourcing tasks that can get in the way. The Ox&amp;Pen team currently consists of determined sales professionals and social media experts, but they outsource their information technology, for web design and application development to maintain their prestigious look and feel. The mobile application is now on its 9th version, continually being updated and improved since its launch in April 2012. To learn more about Ox&amp;Pen download their free mobile application or head over to <a href="http://www.oxandpen.com/" target="_blank">oxandpen.com</a>.

Stay tuned for the next Silicon City episode, featuring Cheeky Chicago on May 3rd. Subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/user/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">SWC TV</a>, SWC’s YouTube channel to access all of our shows and be the first to receive the latest updates on SWC TV.
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Importance Of Solution Design In A SharePoint Deployment</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/sharepoint/importance-of-solution-design-microsoft-sharepoint-deployment</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 01 May 2013 21:30:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[jefflanham]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8740</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of the things I'm often asked to do is help clients understand what <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Services" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint">Microsoft SharePoint</a> is all about and then assist them in envisioning what it will do to bring value to their organizations and solve their business challenges. I usually say that Microsoft SharePoint is a big product with a lot of features and capabilities. But the question isn't “Can SharePoint do X?” it’s always “Of all the many ways SharePoint can do X, which way is the best way to do it for my business?”

It's generally not hard to figure out at least the high-level business requirements for the most common SharePoint value areas. I typically characterize them as: the company intranet, the document repository and the group collaboration environment. Most organizations can benefit from a solution that enables users to understand what's going on now, quickly and easily find needed information, and manage group collaboration around conversations and content. All of those things add up to enhanced productivity, for anyone that can even loosely be described as an “information worker.” When you get a little more specific about these things, you arguably have "defined your business requirements."

So, if defining business requirements isn't challenging, then why are there so many SharePoint implementations out there that fail to meet those business requirements? And, why do so many SharePoint projects end up taking longer than expected, going over budget and ultimately not accomplishing the project's objectives?

I have a theory that it's due to two main things: lack of appropriate design effort during implementation and lack of governance during operations. I have previously published several blog articles on the topic of <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Governance" href="/blog/sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-governance-areas">governance in SharePoint</a>, so I won't go down that rabbit hole again here. But, I do want to dig a little deeper into why I think solution design (or more specifically, functional design) is critical to a successful SharePoint deployment.

SharePoint is a platform, not a turnkey solution. In order for it to do what you need it to do, you have to build it out. You have to create a site structure that makes sense for your business and is also easy to manage and extend. You have to craft a home page that's both engaging and useful to everyone. You have to decide how to organize your document repository initially, migrate your content into it and manage its inevitable growth. Finally, you have to figure out what groups need to collaborate about what, and which tools will help them do that without getting in the way. These are all challenges of functional design.

Defining requirements isn't enough to ensure a successful SharePoint deployment. In fact, it isn't even enough to determine how much time and effort (and therefore money) it will take to build and implement the right SharePoint solution. Effort can vary dramatically for different approaches to seemingly straightforward requirements. Without defining how the requirements will be met via SharePoint capabilities, or getting buy-in from all the relevant stakeholders that your SharePoint solution design will actually meet the requirements and accomplish the business objectives, your odds of a happy outcome drop significantly. You don't have to invest a ton of effort on design – a little can go a long way. But ignore it entirely, and your results will suffer. I promise.
<h2>Here are some examples of good SharePoint design, that are engaging and increase user adoption.</h2>
<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-8742" title="SWC SharePoint Design Holly Hunt" src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-sharepoint-design-holly-hunt.jpg" alt="SWC SharePoint Design Holly Hunt" width="338" height="221" /><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-8743" title="SWC SharePoint Design Midwest Care Center" src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-sharepoint-design-midwest-care-center.jpg" alt="SWC SharePoint Design Midwest Care Center" width="322" height="221" />

To learn more about Microsoft SharePoint, please join SWC for our next informative <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Event" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint#sharepoint-event">Microsoft SharePoint event</a> or follow <a title="Jeff Lanham LinkedIn" href="http://www.linkedin.com/pub/jeff-lanham/22/125/a99" target="_blank">Jeff Lanham on LinkedIn</a>.

If you enjoyed reading this post, please take a moment to read some of Jeff’s past posts on Microsoft SharePoint.

<a title="Microsoft SharePoint Governance Areas" href="/blog/sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-governance-areas">Microsoft SharePoint Governance Areas</a>
<a title="How will Microsoft SharePoint Bring Value to My Business?" href="/blog/sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-bring-value-to-business">How will Microsoft SharePoint Bring Value to My Business?</a>
<a title="Why Your Business Needs a Microsoft SharePoint Governance Plan" href="/blog/sharepoint/business-microsoft-sharepoint-governance-plan">Why Your Business Needs a Microsoft SharePoint Governance Plan</a>
<a title="SharePoint and the Used Car Lot" href="/blog/sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-used-car-lot">SharePoint and the Used Car Lot</a>
<a title="Two Fundamental Approaches to Microsoft SharePoint" href="/blog/sharepoint/fundamental-approaches-microsoft-sharepoint">Two Fundamental Approaches to Microsoft SharePoint</a>
<a title="The SWC SharePoint Way – Part 1" href="/blog/sharepoint/the-swc-sharepoint-way">The SWC SharePoint Way – Part 1</a>
<a title="Designing Your SharePoint Architecture" href="/blog/sharepoint/designing-your-sharepoint-architecture">Designing Your SharePoint Architecture</a>
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SWC’s Beers With Brad – Technology, Security And Privacy</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/beers-with-brad-technology-security-privacy</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Apr 2013 21:48:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[bradellison]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8793</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Another <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">SWC</a> episode of Beers with Brad aired on Friday, April 26th at Binny’s Beverage Depot South Loop store in Chicago. Beers with Brad is a live web show airing on select Fridays at 4 p.m. (CST). Watch this episode to join in the discussion of technology, security and privacy. Is technology invading our privacy? Tune in to find out!

<a title="SWC's Beers With Brad Technology And Security" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Zg1lGBnU3rM?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/BWB-Pic-Security-Technology.jpg" alt="Watch Beers With Brad Technology, Security and Privacy" width="500" height="281" /></a>

Roger Adamson, Beer and Spirits Specialist at <a href="http://www.binnys.com/" target="_blank">Binny’s Beverage Depot</a> in Willowbrook joined us for another episode. Roger brought along three beers that were sampled on the show. They were the Big Daddy IPA and the Prohibition Ale both from San Francisco Speakeasy Ales and Lagers and the Sculpin IPA from Ballast Point Brewing Company. Roger recommended pairing an IPA with a salad or seafood and the Prohibition Ale with barbeque or ribs. Speakeasy Brewing Company will be hitting the shelves this week at all Binny’s locations and Ballast Point Brewing Company will be hosting a party at Binny’s South Loop location on May 8th from 5-8 p.m. to celebrate.

Todd Wickens, Engagement Manager for <a title="Customer Relationship Management" href="/solutions/crm">CRM Solutions</a> at SWC and Sarah Knight, Associate at Seyfarth Shaw LLP, joined Brad Ellison on this past week’s episode to discuss technology and security following recent events related to the explosion at the Boston Marathon. One topic discussed was New York City’s partnership with Microsoft to create a camera system that alarms and notifies authorities of bags that are unattended and criminals that are in the city through facial recognition software. Chicago has also installed a similar technology system within trains and heavily populated areas. Many believe that these cameras are invading privacy, while others hold opposing views. Watch this episode of Beers with Brad to determine if technology is keeping us safe or invading our privacy.

Join us for our next <a title="SWC's Beers With Brad Event Registration" href="/bwb/">Beers with Brad</a> on Friday, May 10th at 4 p.m. (CST). Remember to tweet all your IT questions to <a title="SWC Twitter" href="https://twitter.com/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">@SWCTechPartners</a> to get them answered live on the show.

Please subscribe to our <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5mqIEpTGPQCy7Z1qj-nLlQ?sub_confirmation=1" target="_blank">SWC TV</a> YouTube Channel to get the latest SWC TV videos delivered to your inbox and keep up with SWC’s Beers with Brad and Silicon City shows.

If you enjoyed this post, please take a moment to read a few other related SWC Beers With Brad posts.

		<title>Whose Job is it Anyway? Lync Managed Services to the Rescue</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-managed-services-rescue</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 May 2013 21:00:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[bradcooper]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8870</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Phone systems. Everyone has them, yet there are only a select few who have the knowledge to fully support them. Chances are your IT department is responsible for a phone system that no individual within the company has the time or skillset to fully understand, despite how critical it is to the business. This could cost your company time and money.

<a title="Microsoft Lync 2013" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013">Microsoft Lync</a> offers a solution to provide your company with an innovative way to communicate and collaborate. Despite the familiarity of the Microsoft platform, Lync, like all voice systems requires a specific set of knowledge and skill set. Your team needs to be able to ensure high levels of performance and provide the highest availability of business-critical voice and conferencing services.

That’s where SWC’s <a title="Microsoft Lync Managed Services" href="/solutions/managed-services/microsoft-lync-managed-services">Lync Managed Services</a> comes to the rescue. Our team of experts, coupled with our 24x7 support structure, allows your business to experience the power of Lync with the peace of mind that your systems will be up and running when your workforce needs them.

SWC’s Lync Managed Services offering monitors your Lync infrastructure, provides insight into performance and best practices and supports daily operations. Being proactive on identifying issues and reacting with the highest level of Lync knowledge is what allows SWC to help you keep your business running efficiently and effectively.

Why delay that phone upgrade your company desperately needs. SWC can provide an end-to-end solution for planning, deployment and ongoing support of your Lync infrastructure. Let SWC’s Lync Managed Services team make the phone system our job and sleep tight knowing SWC’s accessible experts have it covered.

If you’d like assistance planning your path and preparing for your Lync 2013, please join us for our next <a title="Unified Communications Event" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Unified Communications event</a>.

To learn more about Microsoft Lync 2013, please read a few of our recent blogs:

<a title="Lync 2013 Keeps Your Voice Mails Home" href="/blog/unified-communications/lync-2013-voice-mail-escape">Lync 2013 Keeps Your Voice Mails Home</a>

		<title>SWC TV Debuts Another Episode of Silicon City</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/swc-tv-silicon-city-cheeky-chicago</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 May 2013 21:25:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8885</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners showcases another episode of Silicon City. Silicon City is a bi-weekly web show focusing on startups in Chicago. The show gives Chicago startups the unique ability to talk about their company, endeavors, experiences and pitch their product. Watch this week’s episode featuring Erica Bethe Levin, Editor and Chief and Jessica Zweig, Director of Sales and Marketing, of Cheeky Chicago.

<a title="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Cheeky Chicago" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/1rPXP6qPCD0?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-silicon-city-cheeky-chicago.png" alt="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Cheeky Chicago" width="474" height="262" /></a>

On this week’s show, Silicon City host <a title="SWC VP Elliott Baretz" href="/swc-technology-partners/leadership/elliott-baretz">Elliott Baretz</a>, Vice President of Marketing and Business Development at SWC, Erica Bethe Levin and Jessica Zweig sit down to discuss all things cheeky in Chicago. Based out of 1871, a great startup hub inside of the Merchandise Mart, Cheeky Chicago has become one of the most talked about startups in the city. Not only do they have an immense following through their online lifestyle magazine, but also through their various events and royalty reward program.

Erica and Jessica are experts and lovers of all things Chicago. Cheeky Chicago was created after they both realized a need for a “city centric female focused guide for Chicago,” said Erica. “We basically solved our own problem,” added Jessica. Cheeky is a “brand that speaks to the cosmopolitan woman and endorses a philosophy to the community that they should be a little cheekier to each other meaning more open hearted, friendlier and warmer. Cheeky aims to create a likeminded community of 24-40 year old girls who are really down to earth, like to live a fun fabulous life and feel a little VIP at times,” said Jessica.

Since their launch in 2008, Cheeky has been focused on building their market in Chicago and expanding to many other cities. They currently have 50,000 readers, 25,000 subscribers and 2,000 Cheeky card holders. In efforts to build their market they will be releasing a mobile application in the next six months for their Cheeky royalty card program. To stay up to date on all things Cheeky Chicago head over to <a href="http://cheekychicago.com/" target="_blank">Cheeky Chicago</a> and subscribe to their online magazine.

Stay tuned for the next Silicon City episode, featuring UrbanBuddy on May 17th. Subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/user/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">SWC TV</a>, SWC’s YouTube channel to access all of our shows and be the first to receive the latest updates on SWC TV.
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Implementing Workflows in Microsoft SharePoint</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/sharepoint/implementing-workflows-microsoft-sharepoint</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 May 2013 19:54:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[jefflanham]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8928</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Of the many ways that <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Solution" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint">Microsoft SharePoint</a> can help people work together more effectively, “workflow” is one of the most elusive real-world scenarios. While the concept of “automating and streamlining repetitive business processes” promises compelling improvements in productivity and manageability, it is rare (in my experience) to find organizations that have successfully implemented workflow solutions in a meaningful way. More often, people plan to implement workflows later in the process, usually during the “run” phase of the typical “crawl - walk – run” approach. The problem is that they never manage to get there.

It doesn't have to be that way. While it's true that complex business processes can be challenging to automate, <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Way" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint/swc-sharepoint-way">Microsoft SharePoint</a> provides a variety of features and capabilities that can be leveraged to improve collaborative processes without necessarily requiring a lot of effort. In fact, SharePoint Server editions include several useful “out-of-the-box” workflows that you can start using with very little effort. They can facilitate easier and more robust document routing for review and approval, among other things. Even better, they can be accessed right inside the Office applications – you can tell SharePoint to circulate your document to one or more individuals automatically, without even leaving Microsoft Word!

If you wish to take a step beyond the default workflows that Microsoft provides, you have several options. In <a title="Microsoft SharePoint 2013" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-2013">Microsoft SharePoint 2013</a>, Microsoft Visio and SharePoint Designer work together to enable business analysts to design, build and deploy simple to moderately complex workflows, without any need for programming. You can graphically lay out the flowchart of your process using Visio 2013's SharePoint Workflow stencils, import your flowchart into SharePoint Designer and from there deploy the “workflow template” to your SharePoint environment. Each time someone needs to manage an example of that business process, they can create a new workflow instance based on the template you defined.

There are, of course, some limitations to the types of workflow templates you can create in Visio and SharePoint Designer. While the 2013 versions do add some new activities and looping capabilities, you still can't create “state machine” workflows. That means that more complex business logic flows will still need to be programmed in Visual Studio and will require the skillset of an experienced SharePoint developer. The good news is that those developers can leverage the full power of the Windows Workflow Foundation engine to do just about anything imaginable.

One final option that can be worth considering is third-party vendors that offer commercial add-ons for SharePoint. There are many options available, but the one I've personally heard the most good things about are the products from Nintex (www.nintex.com). They offer a workflow design environment that is conceptually similar to the Microsoft Visio + SharePoint Designer approach, but includes additional capabilities and enhanced features that reduce the need to develop custom workflow activities and solutions in code.

Regardless of how you approach workflow solutions in SharePoint, there can be a lot of value in leveraging its capabilities to improve your processes. Let your work flow!

To learn more about Microsoft SharePoint, please join SWC for our next informative <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Event" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint#sharepoint-event">Microsoft SharePoint event</a> or follow <a title="Jeff Lanham LinkedIn" href="http://www.linkedin.com/pub/jeff-lanham/22/125/a99" target="_blank">Jeff Lanham on LinkedIn</a>.

If you enjoyed reading this post, please take a moment to read some of Jeff’s past posts on Microsoft SharePoint.

<a title="Why Your Business Needs a Microsoft SharePoint Governance Plan" href="/blog/sharepoint/business-microsoft-sharepoint-governance-plan">Why Your Business Needs a Microsoft SharePoint Governance Plan</a>

	<item>
		<title>Microsoft Exchange, An Enterprise Ready Voicemail Solution</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/microsoft-exchange/microsoft-exchange-enterprise-voicemail-solution</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 May 2013 16:38:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anthonycaragol]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8941</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="Unified Communications Services" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Unified Communications</a> and Unified Messaging are phrases tossed around a lot these days and knowing just who’s offering what can be very confusing. Today, I wanted to talk to you about Microsoft Exchange’s Unified Messaging, an enterprise-ready back end voicemail solution that can work with almost any vendor, whether it’s Cisco, Avaya, Mitel, ShoreTel, or <a title="Microsoft Lync 2013" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013">Microsoft Lync</a>. Here are three compelling reasons why you should throw out your old voicemail solution and switch to Microsoft Exchange.
<h2>Cost</h2>
There’s a good chance you already have an investment Microsoft Exchange on premises or in the cloud. Adding voicemail capabilities isn’t far away and can provide you with significant savings over paying your existing provider for continued maintenance and upgrades.
<h2>Features</h2>
While Exchange has all the standard features you’d expect from a voicemail platform, such as automated attendants, speech recognition and lighting the message waiting lamp on your desk phone, there are many features you might not know about. In Microsoft Outlook Web App users can easily configure custom greetings for different callers and voicemails can appear as emails complete with a speech-to-text translation, making them easily searchable. You can give certain callers the option to hit a number and be transferred to your cell phone or any other programmed number. For example, a specific company listed in your contacts folder may get the option to call your cell phone, so you’re not playing phone tag. Any old voicemail solution lets you call in to listen to your voicemails, but with <a title="Microsoft Exchange 2013" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-exchange-2013">Microsoft Exchange</a> you can call in and listen to not only your voicemail, but also your email on a long drive and even make modifications to your calendar using voice commands.
<h2>Management</h2>
All of these features come in a package that’s familiar to your IT team. Most firms don’t have dedicated phone staff, or if they do, they don’t fully understand the complexities of the systems and rely on outside contractors when it gets difficult. Microsoft Exchange is an easy to manage, trusted and resilient system that your IT staff and employees are already familiar with.

Microsoft Exchange has a lot to offer, no other system integrates more easily or seamlessly with the Office stack than Microsoft. From easy to use advanced features, to simplification of management and a quick return on your investments, why waste your time and money on an outdated voicemail and phone system?

Contact SWC today to talk about how Unified Messaging can help you meet your business objectives, or if you’d like assistance with planning your path and preparing for your Microsoft Exchange migration. To learn more about <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC’s Microsoft Exchange offering, please join us for our next <a title="Unified Communications Event" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Unified Communications event</a> or follow Anthony Caragol on LinkedIn.

If you enjoyed reading this blog, please take a moment to read a few of SWC’s other blogs on Microsoft Unified Communications:

<a title="Microsoft Lync 2013 Resiliency Enhancements" href="/blog/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013-resiliency-enhancements">Microsoft Lync 2013 Resiliency Enhancements</a>
<a title="Lync 2013 Keeps Your Voice Mails Home" href="/blog/unified-communications/lync-2013-voice-mail-escape">Lync 2013 Keeps Your Voice Mails Home</a>
<a title="Microsoft Unified Communications…A Game Changer" href="/blog/unified-communications/microsoft-unified-communications-game-changer">Microsoft Unified Communications…A Game Changer</a>

	<item>
		<title>New Silicon City Featuring UrbanBuddy</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/swc-tv-silicon-city-featuring-urbanbuddy</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 May 2013 16:11:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8959</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners releases another episode of Silicon City featuring UrbanBuddy. Silicon City is a bi-weekly web show that gives Chicago startups the ability to pitch their product, and viewers an inside look of their company and strategies. Watch this week’s episode of Silicon city featuring Paul Brogna, Co-Founder and Global Director and Pete Stam, Co-Founder and Managing Director, of UrbanBuddy.

<a title="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Chicago Start-up UrbanBuddy" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/PdfkeR_xYIo?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-silicon-city-urbanbuddy.png" alt="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring UrbanBuddy" width="474" height="262" /></a>

On this week’s show, Silicon City host <a title="SWC VP Elliott Baretz" href="/swc-technology-partners/leadership/elliott-baretz">Elliott Baretz</a>, Vice President of Marketing and Business Development at SWC, Paul Brogna and Pete Stam sit down to discuss UrbanBuddy. UrbanBuddy is a mobile application that creates on-demand answers for travelers. A network of local experts support travelers every request through the mobile application or in person. UrbanBuddy’s mobile application has a convenient interface that makes it simple to ask a local expert their favorite place to eat, dance or do anything.

Paul and Pete have been traveling around the world for many years now. They both realized the need for this application after studying abroad in Barcelona. The goal of UrbanBuddy is to “connect somebody to a local for the local experience,” stated Paul. To ensure brand trust, Pete and Paul have “invested a lot of money and time into the people who are actually on the ground. We see that as a pillar of what UrbanBuddy is, a local network of people…really making sure they are the best,” said Pete. “The spirit of the brand is all about the people,” stated Paul.

UrbanBuddy is currently located in six cities and expanding rapidly. These cities include: Barcelona, Paris, Berlin, New York, Chicago and Mexico City. Currently, Pete and Paul are creating awareness of UrbanBuddy through people and local businesses. Since the show, the UrbanBuddy mobile application has been launched for iOS devices. The next time you find yourself traveling to one of these cities, make sure you reach out to an UrbanBuddy for all your local needs. 

Stay tuned for the next Silicon City airing on May 31st. Subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/user/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">SWC TV</a>, SWC’s YouTube channel to access all of our shows and be the first to receive the latest updates on SWC TV. If you are a Chicago area startup and would like to have your business featured on Silicon City, please call 630-572-0240.

	<item>
		<title>Compete: How Developing a Solution for the Salesforce.com AppExchange Launched a New Company</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/customer-relationship-management/salesforce-com-crm-appexchange-launched-new-company</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 May 2013 15:43:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[toddwickens]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8975</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="Salesforce.com Customer Relationship Management" href="/solutions/crm/salesforce-com-customer-relationship-management">Salesforce.com</a> is the world’s number one <a title="Customer Relationship Management" href="/solutions/crm">Customer Relationship Management system</a>, providing a comprehensive solution for sales force automation, customer service, partner management, and marketing and campaign management. When Detroit-based digital engagement agency ePrize deployed Salesforce.com to their organization, executives realized that the adoption of the new CRM platform was going to be a challenge. The company turned to <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners, to build Compete, the number one Salesforce gamification app, and in the process successfully created a new company called LevelEleven.

<a title="IT Consultants SWC And LevelEleven Salesforce.com Application" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/eBSCVHyFwEM?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/Level-Eleven.jpg" alt="SWC Salesforce.com Customer Relationship Management LevelEleven" width="474" height="262" /></a>

ePrize is a digital engagement agency specialized in motivating consumer behavior for over 250 of the top 500 brands in America. They were using Salesforce.com as a sales and Customer Relationship Management solution and were looking for a tool to increase adoption and reward salespeople for using the product. Managers tried running sales contests for behaviors like making the most calls, booking the most meetings and converting leads – all to be tracked by Salesforce, but could not find an application available to do so within the platform’s existing functionality. ePrize responded by developing their own solution and hired SWC to build it.

The project became so successful that it took on a life of its own and ePrize decided to spin it out and create its own company, called LevelEleven. LevelEleven is now focused on building software used by sales organization and call centers to keep salespeople focused on the right things, by taking the data in a company’s CRM system and using it to motivate their sales force. The app was originally launched at Dreamforce 2011, received a lot of positive feedback and has since been sold to many prominent customers. Today, Compete is the number one gamification app in the Salesforce App Exchange.

If you are interested in learning more about SWC’s CRM solutions, please join us for our next informative <a title="Salesforce.com Events" href="/events">Salesforce.com event</a>.

If you enjoyed reading this post, please take a moment to read a few of our other posts on Customer Relationship Management:

<a title="Maximizing User Adoption in CRM Deployment" href="/blog/customer-relationship-management/maximizing-user-adoption-crm">Maximizing User Adoption in CRM Deployment</a>
<a title="Common CRM Mistakes and How You Can Avoid Making Them" href="/blog/customer-relationship-management/common-crm-mistakes">Common CRM Mistakes and How You Can Avoid Making Them</a>
<a title="Best Practices for Marketing Automation in CRM" href="/blog/customer-relationship-management/best-practices-marketing-automation-crm">Best Practices for Marketing Automation in CRM</a>
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SWC&#039;s Beers With Brad - CIO Tech Talk</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/beers-with-brad-cio-tech-talk</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 May 2013 18:18:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[bradellison]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=8989</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Beers with Brad was live again on Friday, May 10! The show introduced a new format which features CIOs discussing their careers, ventures, and the exciting technology projects they are working on. This gives viewers the unique opportunity to view a day in the life of a CIO and learn more about innovative <a title="Technology Solutions" href="/swc-technology-partners/about-swc">technology solutions</a> that are having the greatest impact on midmarket businesses. Watch this week’s episode featuring Vito Trifiletti, CIO of Preferred Meal Systems.

<a title="SWC's Beers With Brad Technology And Security" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/MXhvgcZT2os?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-beers-with-brad-cio-tech-talk.jpg" alt="Watch Beers With Brad Technology, Security and Privacy" width="500" height="281" /></a>

Roger Adamson, Beer and Spirits Specialist at <a href="http://www.binnys.com/" target="_blank">Binny’s Beverage Depot</a> in Willowbrook was back to discuss beer with Brad Ellison, Consultant and Engagement Manager at <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC and Vito Trifiletti, CIO at Preferred Meal Systems. Roger sampled two beers on this show, the Bottom Up Wit from Revolution Brewing Company and the Domaine Dupage from Two Brothers Brewing Company. The Bottom Up Wit is brewed with orange peels and coriander, a brewing spice, and pairs well with warmer weather since it is a great thirst quencher. Two Brothers Brewing Company started out as a home brew shop until it became quite popular and decided to launch as a company. The Domaine Dupage is great to have at dinner and paired with a more “fancy” meal.

After the beer discussion, Brad and Vito had the opportunity to discuss what it’s like to be the CIO at Preferred Meal Systems and all of the new technologies they are implementing. Preferred Meal Systems is a leading provider of meal solutions for more than 40 years, with clients ranging from schools to airlines and senior living facilities. As CIO, Vito is the company’s technology leader and gets to works with every business function from sales to marketing to supply chain, logistics and finance completing both operational tasks and strategic technology projects as well. He frequently meets with senior executives to help work through the business challenges they are facing and help them use technology to improve their operations, standardize processes and set up workflows. The company also does a lot of work with the Microsoft stack, particularly <a title="Microsoft SharePoint Consulting" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint">Microsoft SharePoint</a>, <a title="Microsoft CRM Consulting" href="/solutions/crm/microsoft-dynamics-customer-relationship-management">Microsoft Dynamics CRM</a> and <a title="Microsoft Exchange Consulting" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-exchange-2013">Microsoft Exchange</a> to help drive business results.

Some of the game changing technologies Preferred Meals Systems is implementing for their customers include a new online menu system. SWC Technology Partners digital design and software solutions teams are currently completing this project, which will give parents the ability to check their child’s lunch menu and its nutritional values while on the go, using their mobile devices. The company also uses numerous technologies daily to keep all of their products organized and maintained, such as voice directed warehousing. This innovative solution allows warehouse workers to wear a headset, so their hands are free while a computer talks helping them sort, maintain and find cases. Watch this week’s episode of Beers with Brad or head over to <a href="http://www.preferredmealsystems.com" target="_blank">PreferredMealySystems.com</a> to hear more about this technology and many others that Vito and his team have been working on.

Don’t forget to subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5mqIEpTGPQCy7Z1qj-nLlQ?sub_confirmation=1" target="_blank">SWC TV</a> YouTube Channel by June 1st for the chance to win $250! Stay tuned for our next episode of Beers with Brad on May 31st.

If you enjoyed this post, please take a moment to read a few other related SWC Beers With Brad posts.

	<item>
		<title>Silicon City Featuring Chicago Startup TransitChatter</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/silicon-city-featuring-chicago-startup-transitchatter</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 May 2013 19:51:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=9048</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners premieres another exciting episode of Silicon City featuring TransitChatter. Silicon City is a bi-weekly web show focusing on the Chicago startup community. Previously, Silicon City has featured <a title="Chicago Ox&amp;Pen" href="/blog/silicon-city/swc-tv-announces-silicon-city">Ox&amp;Pen</a>, <a title="Cheeky Chicago" href="/blog/events/swc-tv-silicon-city-cheeky-chicago">Cheeky Chicago</a> and <a title="Chicago UrbanBuddy" href="/blog/events/swc-tv-silicon-city-featuring-urbanbuddy">UrbanBuddy</a>. Tune in to this week’s episode featuring Co-Founders Samuel Pro and David Rogers of Chicago's TransitChatter.

<a title="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Chicago Start-up TransitChatter" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/oQYFfvRDpQM?rel=0" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-silicon-city-transitchatter.jpg" alt="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring UrbanBuddy" width="474" height="262" /></a>

On this week’s episode of Silicon City, host Elliott Baretz, Vice President of Business Development and head of <a title="Chicago Digital Design Services" href="/solutions/digital-design">Digital Design services</a> at SWC discusses growing startup TransitChatter with Samuel Pro and David Rogers. TransitChatter is a mobile application that makes Chicago’s transit system a fun social experience. The application gives riders the ability to “connect to each other, the system, businesses and events that they pass by every day,” said Samuel. This unique mobile application allows riders to talk to each other and get local deals for the stops they are headed too. TransitChatter was built to enhance the experience for commuters on public transportation.

Being entrepreneurs came naturally for Samuel and David, who have extensive knowledge in digital design, coding and mobile application development. The idea of TransitChatter came after the realization that people were “missing out on a lot of opportunities and things to do,” said Samuel, “We use technology to address these problems.” David, who has a design background and Samuel, who has a technology background used their knowledge to create the UI design and development of the first mobile application. “I created the native versions of the iOS and Android for TransitChatter and it talks to Sam’s code,” said David. They outsourced their IT, when developing the Android mobile version, which later helped them create a better application through their own coding and design.

Currently, TransitChatter has 650 daily unique users and 80 paying businesses. Samuel and David have big plans for the future and expect these numbers to grow rapidly throughout 2013. If you are interested in learning more about TransitChatter download their free mobile application or head over to <a href="http://transitchatter.com/" target="_blank">TransitChatter</a>.

SWC has worked with many companies providing similar services ranging from Digital Design, Mobile Application Development and SEO. Contact Chicago area IT consulting firm SWC if you are interested in any of these services.

Stay tuned for the next Silicon City airing on June 14th. Subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/user/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">SWC TV</a>, SWC’s YouTube channel to access all of our shows and be the first to receive the latest updates on SWC TV. If you are a Chicago area startup and would like to have your business featured on Silicon City, please call 630-572-0240.
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Kids Say The Darndest Things…About SWC</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/swc-technology-partners/kids-say-the-darndest-things-about-it-consultants-swc</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 03 Jun 2013 20:31:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=9071</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We invited some very special guests to our office to see what they had to say about SWC and our solutions. Watch our video below to find out what kids are saying about SWC Technology Partners.

<a title="IT Consultants SWC - How Kids View Technology" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/DKCwwTqBoLw?rel=0&amp;autoplay=1" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/featured-video_kids.jpg" alt="What Kids Think About SWC" width="474" height="262" /></a>

At <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC, we serve mid-market companies, helping them define, deploy and support technology solutions. We specialize in the following solutions:

<strong>Microsoft SharePoint:</strong> SWC has been working with <a title="Microsoft SharePoint 2013" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint">Microsoft SharePoint</a> since the inception of the product, deploying hundreds of SharePoint solutions in dozens of industries. Microsoft SharePoint helps our clients collaborate, communicate and manage documents and workflows. Our kids said that sharing was very important and if you have more of something than someone else, you should share with them.

<strong>Business Intelligence:</strong> SWC helps its clients gather and analyze data helping them make better business decisions. SWC has developed robust analysis solutions for multiple industries, including real estate, consumer product marketing, transportation and finance. When asked what <a title="Business Intelligence Consulting" href="/solutions/business-intelligence">Business Intelligence</a> is, our kids got it right. They knew business intelligence was something that makes businesses work better.

<strong>Virtual Database Administrator (VDBA):</strong> SWC helps its clients get the most of their SQL database through its <a title="Virtual Database Administrator Services" href="/solutions/managed-services/virtual-dba">Virtual DBA</a> program, by offering extraordinary database expertise without an extraordinary increase to the payroll. Our kids weren’t so sure about this one!

<strong>Customer Relationship Management (CRM):</strong> CRM solutions help SWC clients sell, manage and service their customers more effectively. SWC has extensive experience customizing and deploying <a title="Salesforce.com CRM" href="/solutions/crm/salesforce-com-customer-relationship-management">Salesforce.com</a> and <a title="Microsoft CRM Consulting" href="/solutions/crm/microsoft-dynamics-customer-relationship-management">Microsoft Dynamics CRM</a>. When asked about CRM, our kids knew it was important to be good to your customers and keep them happy.

<strong>Microsoft System Center:</strong> SWC specializes in deploying System Center for mid-market organizations. Technology has a lot of moving parts and SWC clients leverage Microsoft System Center to put things in order. Our kids said that <a title="Microsoft System Center Services" href="solutions/microsoft-system-center">Microsoft System Center</a> is a center for systems and makes computers work.

<strong>Virtualization:</strong> Through <a title="Virtualization Consulting Services" href="/solutions/virtualization">virtualization</a>, SWC clients operate multiple servers on single hardware units reducing the need for space, power and administrative overhead. SWC specializes in the design and deployment of Microsoft Hyper V, VMware and Citrix virtualization solutions. Our kids suggested this makes things more virtual on a computer.

<strong>Microsoft Windows:</strong> Over 90% of all desktops run <a title="Microsoft Windows Services" href="/solutions/microsoft-windows">Microsoft Windows</a> as their operating system. Almost 50% of all desktops will upgrade to Windows 7 or 8 in the next twelve months. Our kids knew all about Microsoft and that it is a program that people create things from.

<strong>Unified Communications:</strong> <a title="Unified Communications Services" href="/solutions/unified-communications">Unified Communications</a> is the consolidation of telephony, email, voicemail, calendaring, Instant Messaging (IM) and web conferencing in one system. SWC leverages Microsoft Exchange and Microsoft Lync as the cornerstone of its Unified Communications solution. Our kids were very familiar with communicating through group chat, texting and Facebook.

<strong>Managed Services:</strong> Many SWC clients want to focus on their own business and not the technology that surrounds it. SWC teams with these organizations by providing 24/7 IT monitoring and support, which includes patching and updating, remediation and repair, remote and onsite services and strategic planning. Our kids said that <a title="Managed Services" href="/solutions/managed-services">Managed Services</a> is when people do things for you and they were right!

<strong>Web Design and SEO:</strong> Human beings decide if they like something in 1/10 of a second. Websites have to look good and be easy to use. SWC <a title="Chicago Digital Design Services" href="/solutions/digital-design">digital design</a> specializes in WordPress, SharePoint design and Search Engine Optimizations. Our favorite SWC pet had no comment on this.

To learn more about the SWC solutions mentioned, please join us for our next <a title="Chicago IT Events" href="/events">Chicago area event</a>.</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Microsoft System Center Replacement Tools</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/microsoft-system-center/ms-system-center-replacement-tools</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jun 2013 14:03:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[bradellison]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=9084</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Microsoft has introduced a wave of innovation in 2013 with the release of <a title="Microsoft SharePoint 2013" href="/solutions/microsoft-sharepoint/microsoft-sharepoint-2013">SharePoint 2013</a>, <a title="Microsoft Lync 2013" href="/solutions/unified-communications/microsoft-lync-2013">Lync 2013</a> and Office 2013 that is changing the way we do business. But one of the big questions in IT is how to effectively and efficiently manage Microsoft’s new stack of products. At <a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC, we have deployed Microsoft System Center for many mid-market organizations to help consolidate management and cost. System Center offers a breadth of capabilities and solutions for physical and virtual systems monitoring, management, backup and security. There are many products that comprise Microsoft System Center, in this blog I wanted to share a few tools that many companies are currently operating in their environments that System Center can replace.

<strong>System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM)</strong>
System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) is a tool that can be used for desktop deployment and management. SCCM will impact your business and help you empower your users with all of the applications and devices they need, allowing them to become more productive, while IT still maintains control. System Center Configuration Manager can replace, the following products:
<ul>
	<li>Desktop imaging products, including Altiris, FOG, Ghost and Zenworks</li>
	<li>Application development products, including Flexera, Kayesa, and Specops</li>
	<li>Third-party AV products, including McAfee, Symantec, Trend, etc.</li>
	<li>Acronis, Kace and other inventory, reporting and imaging tools</li>
</ul>
<strong>System Center Operations Manager (SCOM)</strong>
System Center Operations Manager (SCOM) can be used to monitor and manage your infrastructure. The tool can provide application diagnostics and ensure all of your systems are available and performing. System Center Operations Manager can replace the following products for management and monitoring: BizMon, Frends, Helium, Minotaur, Solarwinds and Spiceworks.

<strong>System Center Data Protection Manager (SCDPM)</strong>
System Center Data Protection Manager (SCDPM) provides cost-effective data protection, replacing alternative products, such as Acronis, Backup Exec, CA, Commvault and replication tools. SCDPM can also be used to restore disk, tape and off premise scenarios.

<strong>System Center Service Manager (SCSM)</strong>
System Center Service Manager (SCSM) can be used as a Help Desk tool. The product can replace products like Assyst, CA, Manage Engine, Numara, Service Desk Plus and Trackit. It can also be used to replace any third party help desk ticketing software, especially ones that aren’t integrated with Active Directory.

<strong>System Center Endpoint Protection</strong>
System Center Endpoint Protection can be used as an anti-virus, consolidating security and management. The tool can be used to replace products like Symantec AV and spyware tools.

<strong>Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) / System Center Virtual Machine Manager (SCVMM)</strong>
Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) and System Center Virtual Machine Manager (SCVMM) can be used to provide deployment services and virtual machine management for your environment, giving you a cost-effective private cloud. The tool can replace products like HyperV Manager , Failover Cluster Manager and Solarwinds Virtualization Manager.

<strong>System Center Orchestrator</strong>
System Center Orchestrator is a solution commonly used for workflow management. It is a good replacement for Puppet Automation and vCenter Orchestrator.

SWC currently offers a Microsoft System Center assessment and business managed tools analysis. As part of our assessment and analysis, we will look at the dozens of tools your business is currently using that could be replaced by Microsoft System Center, allowing you to consolidate management and costs. We will also provide a roadmap to deployment, if you’re an XP end of life candidate or looking into a desktop refresh, this will give you guidance on how to get you there. Finally, we also deliver mobile landscape recommendations as part of the assessment on how to use System Center for tablet management.

Whether it’s SCCM, SCDPM, SCSM, SCOM, SCVMM, or EndPoint Protection, or a hybrid approach, SWC can help you make sense of all of the Microsoft System Center tools, so that you can better manage your IT environment. The Power to manage is closer than you think with <a title="Microsoft System Center 2012" href="/solutions/microsoft-system-center">Microsoft System Center 2012</a>!

Contact SWC today to talk about how Microsoft System Center can help you meet your business objectives. To learn more about SWC’s Microsoft System Center offering, please join us for our next <a title="Microsoft System Center Events" href="/events">System Center event</a> or follow <a title="Brad Ellison Linked-In" href="http://www.linkedin.com/pub/brad-ellison/70/1aa/a03" target="_blank">Brad Ellison on LinkedIn</a>.

If you enjoyed reading this blog, please take a moment to read a few of SWC’s other blogs on Microsoft System Center:

<a title="How Microsoft System Center 2012 Manages the Private Cloud" href="/blog/microsoft-system-center/how-ms-system-center-2012-manages-private-cloud">How Microsoft System Center 2012 Manages the Private Cloud</a>
<a title="What is the Private Cloud?" href="/blog/microsoft-system-center/what-is-the-private-cloud">What is the Private Cloud?</a>
<a title="The Top Features of Microsoft System Center 2012" href="/blog/microsoft-system-center/top-features-microsoft-system-center-2012">The Top Features of Microsoft System Center 2012</a>
<a title="SWC Taps Beers With Brad" href="/blog/microsoft-system-center/swc-taps-beers-with-brad">SWC Taps Beers With Brad</a>
</content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>SWC’s Virtual Database Administration (VDBA) Solution</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/virtual-dba/swc-virtual-database-administration-vdba-solution</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 11 Jun 2013 13:15:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[rachaelnarel]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=9103</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners, currently provides <a title="Virtual Database Administrator Services" href="/solutions/managed-services/virtual-dba">virtual database administration services</a> to help assess and maintain your <a title="Microsoft SQL Server Consulting" href="/solutions/business-intelligence/microsoft-sql-server-2012">Microsoft SQL Server</a> environment. Our expert VDBA’s can complement your internal IT team, providing the SQL expertise needed to help resolve performance issues, reports that are taking too long to generate, slow running applications, or help you upgrade your SQL environment or add more BI assets, such as dashboards, reports and spreadsheets. Watch our video below to learn more about SWC’s VDBA solution, which starts with a SQL Server assessment.

<a title="Virtual Database Administrator SWC Technology Partners VDBA Services" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/zluF1f06mpM?rel=0&amp;autoplay=1" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/featured-video_rachel-narel.jpg" alt="Virtual Database Administrator VDBA Services" width="560" height="315" /></a>

As part of SWC’s <a title="Microsoft SQL Server Assessment" href="/solutions/managed-services/virtual-dba">SQL Server assessment</a>, we look at your entire SQL environment, including maintenance plans, operating systems, Disaster Recovery, back-ups, memory and space allocations and temporary files. We then compare them to best practices and provide recommendations to implement that will improve performance and your environment. SWC can also look at any necessary remediation plans that need to take place.

As part of the SQL assessment, we provide you with two detailed documents, a summary document that high-levels your environment and the recommendations, and a very detailed document that goes through every minute detail of your SQL databases. This document can be used for Disaster Recovery, audit, or as a repository document that contains all of the information about your database. In some cases, we then partner with our clients for an ongoing monthly VDBA service to augment their internal IT team and provide SQL Server monitoring and maintenance over time. We watch the maintenance activities and logs and monitor for any alerts or anomalies in memory usage in your environment, so that you can focus on more strategic projects, while we take care of the day-to-day maintenance for you.

Consider allowing SWC to partner with you on a SQL server assessment!

If you would like to learn more about SWC’s Virtual DBA solution or our specialized <a title="Managed IT Services" href="/solutions/managed-services/managed-it-solutions">managed services offering</a>, call SWC today <span class="baec5a81-e4d6-4674-97f3-e9220f0136c1" style="white-space: nowrap;">1-630-572-0240<a style="position: static !important; margin: 0px; width: 16px; bottom: 0px; display: inline; white-space: nowrap; float: none; height: 16px; vertical-align: middle; overflow: hidden; cursor: hand; right: 0px; top: 0px; left: 0px;" title="Call: 1-630-572-0240" href="#"><img style="position: static !important; margin: 0px; width: 16px; bottom: 0px; display: inline; white-space: nowrap; float: none; height: 16px; vertical-align: middle; overflow: hidden; cursor: hand; right: 0px; top: 0px; left: 0px;" title="Call: 1-630-572-0240" src="data:image/png;base64," alt="" /></a></span>, or register for one of our next <a title="Business Intelligence Event" href="/solutions/business-intelligence">Business Intelligence</a> or <a title="Managed Services Events" href="/events">Managed Services events</a>.

If you enjoyed reading this post, please take a moment to read a few of our previous technology posts:

<a title="How to Fast Track Business Intelligence" href="/blog/business-intelligence/fast-track-bi">How to Fast Track Business Intelligence</a>
<a title="A Day In The Life Of A VDBA" href="/blog/virtual-dba/day-in-the-life-of-vdba">A Day In The Life Of A VDBA</a>
<a title="Agile BI Software Solution" href="/blog/business-intelligence/agile-bi-software-solution">Agile BI Software Solution</a>

	<item>
		<title>Silicon City Featuring Peter Liu Of Chicago&#039;s New World Ventures</title>
		<link>http://www.swc.com/blog/events/silicon-city-peter-liu-chicago-new-world-ventures</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Jun 2013 15:20:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[elliottbaretz]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.swc.com/?p=9111</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a title="IT Consulting Firm" href="http://www.swc.com">IT consulting firm</a>, SWC Technology Partners premieres another exciting episode of Silicon City! Silicon City is a bi-weekly web show focusing on the startup community in Chicago. This episode shows a unique view of the Chicago startup ecosystem. Watch this week’s episode featuring Peter Liu, Associate at New World Ventures.

<a title="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Peter Liu With Chicago VC New World Ventures" href="http://www.youtube.com/embed/6zb5nrcEwoI?rel=0&amp;autoplay=1" rel="shadowbox; player=iframe; width=720; height=480"><img src="http://www.swc.com/uploads/swc-silicon-city-new-world-ventures.png" alt="SWC TV Presents Silicon City Featuring Peter Liu With New World Ventures" width="474" height="262" /></a>

On this week’s episode of Silicon City, host Elliott Baretz, Vice President of Business Development and head of <a title="Chicago Digital Design Services" href="/solutions/digital-design">Digital Design Services</a> at SWC discusses the Chicago ecosystem with Peter Liu. Peter is an Associate at New World Ventures, an investment firm that works with entrepreneurs to build leading <a title="Information Technology Company" href="/swc-technology-partners/about-swc">information technology companies</a>. New World Ventures is growing and currently has offices located in Chicago and Los Angeles.

“The Chicago market has really matured in the last couple years,” says Peter. Chicago has developed a lot of great people, companies and places that have contributed to the success of so many startups. Another great location promoting and helping startups is 1871. “It has really become the technology town hall for startups,” stated Peter. With mentors, educators and venture capitalists all in the same building, who wouldn’t want to be located in 1871?

Peter also gave some great insight for what New World Ventures is looking for in their next deal. “I know this will sound like a broken record but it's team, team, team…more often than not the team’s ability to execute is more important than the product itself. We are always evaluating the team whether it’s the initial meeting, the pitch, or in the boardroom. We’re seeing how you sell the companies, how you interact with your other co-founders and with your employees. It’s the team we believe is the real driver of a business. Other than that obviously we are looking for big innovative ideas that are creating a solution to problems that are out there in the market today,” said Peter. “In order to achieve success it is important to surround yourself with great people steering you in the right direction.”

Finally, Peter gave a word of advice for picking a venture capitalist. “We’re not investors at the end of the day, we are a partner,” he states. “You are in it for the long haul with a VC and need to make sure they can provide value to you in more sense than just their dollars. They should be able to help you open doors to customers, provide domain expertise or have access to entrepreneurs and folks who can really help you build your business.” To learn more about Peter Liu or New World Venture head over to <a href="http://www.newworldvc.com" target="_blank">newworldvc.com</a> or follow Peter on Twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/pdotliu" target="_blank">@Pdotliu</a>.

Stay tuned for the next Silicon City airing on June 28. Don't forget to subscribe to <a title="SWC TV YouTube" href="http://www.youtube.com/user/SWCTechPartners" target="_blank">SWC TV</a>, SWC’s YouTube channel to access all of our shows and be the first to receive the latest updates on SWC TV. If you are a Chicago area startup and would like to have your business featured on Silicon City, please call 630-572-0240.
</content:encoded>
